backup.translation[0].definitions[0].def: something that you can use to replace something that does not work or is lost
backup.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a copy of a computer document, program etc, which is made in case the original becomes lost or damaged
backup.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Make a backup of any work you do on the computer.
backup.translation[0].definitions[2].def: people or things that can be used to provide support and help if they are needed
backup.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Army units can only operate if they have sufficient backup.
backup.translation[0].definitions[3].def: someone who will play in a sports team if one of the other players is injured or ill
backup.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a copy of information held on a computer that is put onto a DISK so that the information is not lost if there is a problem with the computer
backup.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Take a backup copy of the file to be converted.
